answerText: Lewis dot structures[10] This phenomenon occurs when a molecule requires multiple Lewis structures to depict. In this phenomenon, electron density is delocalized over several different atoms and bonds.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 5 | 4 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The formal charge, if nonzero, is depicted on these diagrams as a superscript outside of the brackets. For 10 points each: [10] Identify these diagrams, named for an American chemist, which depicts bonds as single lines and electrons as dots. They are used to depict molecules, though in organic chemistry skeleton diagrams are preferred.
